description: Provides preview for Markdown Using MicroMark Processor.
salesforcedocs.preview.breaks.desc:
Sets how line-breaks are rendered in the Markdown preview. Setting it to 'true' creates a
for newlines inside paragraphs.
salesforcedocs.preview.doubleClickToSwit: Double click in the markdown preview to switch to the editor.
salesforcedocs.preview.markEditorSelecti: Mark the current editor selection in the markdown preview.
salesforcedocs.preview.scrollEditorWithP: When a markdown preview is scrolled, update the view of the editor.
salesforcedocs.preview.scrollPreviewWith: When a markdown editor is scrolled, update the view of the preview.
salesforcedocs.preview.title: Open SalesforceDocs Markdown Preview
salesforcedocs.previewSide.title: Open SalesforceDocs Preview to the Side
salesforcedocs.showLockedPreviewToSide.t: Open Locked SalesforceDocs Preview to the Side
salesforcedocs.showSource.title: Show Markdown
salesforcedocs.styles.dec: A list of URLs or local paths to CSS style sheets to use from the markdown preview. Relative paths are interpreted relative to the folder open in the explorer. If there is no open folder, they are interpreted relative to the location of the markdown file. All '\' need to be written as '\\'.
salesforcedocs.trace.desc: Enable debug logging for the markdown extension.
salesforcedocs.preview.refresh.title: Refresh Preview
salesforcedocs.preview.toggleLock.title: Toggle Preview Locking
configuration.salesforcedocs.preview.ope: Controls how links to other markdown files in the markdown preview should be opened.
Try to open links in the editor
Try to open links in the markdown preview
configuration.salesforcedocs.links.openL: Controls where links in markdown files should be opened.
Open links in the active editor group.
Open links beside the active editor.
configuration.salesforcedocs.preview.sty: Choose the base style preset for your Preview
Choose Salesforcedocs styling for your preview
Choose basic Visual Studio Code markdown styling for your preview
telemetry_setting_description: Specifies whether to enable Salesforce telemetry. Even when enabled, still abides by the overall `telemetry.enableTelemetry` vscode setting.
